import Mathlib

/--
Let (x_n) be a convergent monotone sequence in ‚Ñù. Suppose there exists k ‚àà ‚Ñï such that
lim_{n ‚Üí ‚àû} x_n = x_k. Then x_n = x_k for all n ‚â• k.
This formulation allows monotone to mean either nondecreasing (Monotone) or nonincreasing (Antitone).
-/
theorem monotone_seq_eq_of_limit_eq_term (x : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñù) (k : ‚Ñï)
  (hmono : Monotone x ‚à® Antitone x)
  (hlim : Tendsto x atTop (ùìù (x k))) :
  ‚àÄ n, n ‚â• k ‚Üí x n = x k := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/--
Let (x_n) be a convergent monotone sequence in ‚Ñù. Suppose there exists k ‚àà ‚Ñï such that
lim_{n ‚Üí ‚àû} x_n = x_k. Then x_n = x_k for all n ‚â• k.
This formulation allows monotone to mean either nondecreasing (Monotone) or nonincreasing (Antitone).
-/
theorem monotone_seq_eq_of_limit_eq_term (x : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñù) (k : ‚Ñï)
  (hmono : Monotone x ‚à® Antitone x)
  (hlim : Filter.Tendsto x Filter.atTop (nhds (x k))) :
  ‚àÄ n, n ‚â• k ‚Üí x n = x k := by sorry
